Description: Textile fragment of mummy wrapping; rectangular fragment of linen, medium quality, undyed, colour now yellowish light buff with darker areas due to modern dust. Edges torn. Some wear; wear shows that this fragment of linen had a previous use. The weave is plain [warp-faced simple tabby] and the threads are S-spliced and S-twisted; the stitch gauge is warp c.22-23 ends per 10mm and weft c.9 picks per 10mm.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Dr Augustus Bozzi Granville
Acquisition notes: Wrapped, together with EA 75993, 75994 and 75996, in paper labelled in 19th century hand, 'Mummy Clothes various (No. 2)' and in pencil, 'Granville'. Probably from the mummy of Irtyersenu, unwrapped by A B Granville in 1821.
